transportAdvice: Adelaide has a public transit network of buses, trains, and a free city tram that covers the CBD and major tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The city centre is walkable and taxis are readily available, though a car is useful for exploring the Barossa Valley and other regional attractions.

Continues hot and dry, often the driest month of the year with long sunny days.
Late summer brings slightly cooler days and the first hints of autumn relief.
Pleasant autumn weather with mild temperatures and increasing rainfall.
Cooler and wetter as winter approaches, with comfortable daytime temperatures.
Cool and rainy winter month with short days and occasional cold fronts.
The coldest and wettest month, with crisp mornings and frequent winter showers.
Still cool and wet but days gradually lengthen toward the end of the month.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and a mix of sunny days and showers.
Lovely spring weather with wildflowers blooming and increasingly warm sunny days.
Warm and mostly dry with long daylight hours and ideal outdoor conditions.
Hot early summer with low rainfall and plenty of sunshine, perfect for festivals and outdoor dining.
